description.zh-cn: 中华民国作家，以官话白话文的散文和新诗著称。曾任清华大学、国立西南联合大学中国文学系主任。
description.en: A writer of the Republic of China, renowned for his prose and modern poetry in Vernacular Chinese. He served as the head of the Chinese Literature Department at Tsinghua University and National Southwest Associated University.

description.zh-cn: 朱自清的第一任妻子。
description.en: Zhu Ziqing's first wife.

description.zh-cn: 朱自清的第二任妻子。
description.en: Zhu Ziqing's second wife.

description.zh-cn: 朱自清的父亲。
description.en: Zhu Ziqing's father.

description.zh-cn: 朱自清的母亲。
description.en: Zhu Ziqing's mother.

description.zh-cn: 朱自清的二弟，著名无线电学家。
description.en: Zhu Ziqing's second younger brother, a famous radio scientist.

description.zh-cn: 朱自清的长子，中国共产党党员，在1951年镇反运动中被处决。
description.en: Zhu Ziqing's eldest son, a member of the Communist Party of China, executed during the Campaign to Suppress Counterrevolutionaries in 1951.

description.zh-cn: 位于江苏省，是朱自清的出生地。
description.en: A county in Jiangsu province, birthplace of Zhu Ziqing.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期的北京，朱自清在此逝世。
description.en: The name for Beijing during the Republic of China era, where Zhu Ziqing passed away.

description.zh-cn: 中国的一所著名大学，朱自清的母校。
description.en: A renowned university in China, Zhu Ziqing's alma mater.

description.zh-cn: 中国的一所著名大学，朱自清曾在此任教并担任系主任。
description.en: A renowned university in China where Zhu Ziqing taught and served as a department head.

description.zh-cn: 位于英国伦敦的公立研究型大学，朱自清曾在此进修。
description.en: A public research university in London, UK, where Zhu Ziqing pursued further studies.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争期间由国立北京大学、国立清华大学和私立南开大学在中国昆明临时合并而成的一所综合性大学，朱自清在此担任中文系主任。
description.en: A comprehensive university formed by the temporary merger of National Peking University, National Tsinghua University, and the private Nankai University in Kunming, China, during the Second Sino-Japanese War. Zhu Ziqing served as the head of the Chinese department here.

description.zh-cn: 1919年发生于中国的反帝、反封建的爱国运动，朱自清积极参与其中。
description.en: An anti-imperialist, anti-feudal patriotic movement in China in 1919, in which Zhu Ziqing actively participated.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代作家、教育家、文学出版家和社会活动家，与朱自清是文学上的长期伙伴。
description.en: A modern Chinese writer, educator, literary publisher, and social activist, and a long-term literary partner of Zhu Ziqing.

description.zh-cn: 新诗运动以来最早的诗刊之一，由朱自清、俞平伯、叶圣陶、刘延陵等人创办。
description.en: One of the earliest poetry journals since the New Poetry Movement, founded by Zhu Ziqing, Yu Pingbo, Ye Shengtao, Liu Yanling, and others.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代诗人、作家、红学家，与朱自清共同创办《诗》月刊。
description.en: A modern Chinese poet, writer, and redologist, who co-founded the 'Poetry' monthly with Zhu Ziqing.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代诗人，与朱自清共同创办《诗》月刊。
description.en: A modern Chinese poet, who co-founded the 'Poetry' monthly with Zhu Ziqing.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代散文家、文学理论家、评论家、诗人、翻译家、思想家，曾高度评价朱自清的散文。
description.en: A modern Chinese essayist, literary theorist, critic, poet, translator, and thinker, who highly praised Zhu Ziqing's prose.

description.zh-cn: 朱自清的散文处女作，发表后即获好评。
description.en: Zhu Ziqing's debut prose work, which received critical acclaim upon publication.

description.zh-cn: 位于浙江温州的一所中学，朱自清曾在此任教并为其创作校歌。
description.en: A high school in Wenzhou, Zhejiang, where Zhu Ziqing taught and wrote its school song.

nodes.id: 抗议美国扶日政策并拒绝领取美援面粉宣言

zh-cn: 抗议美国扶日政策并拒绝领取美援面粉宣言
抗议美国扶植日本和拒绝领取“美援”面粉的宣言

description.zh-cn: 一份由中国知识分子签署的政治宣言，抗议美国战后对日本的政策，并拒绝领取美国援助的面粉。朱自清在上面签了名。
description.en: A political declaration signed by Chinese intellectuals protesting the post-war US policy towards Japan and refusing to accept American relief flour. Zhu Ziqing was one of the signatories.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东为新华社撰写的评论，其中“朱自清一身重病，宁可饿死，不领美国的救济粮”的描述，导致了公众对朱自清死因的普遍误解。
description.en: A commentary written by Mao Zedong for Xinhua News Agency. Its description that 'Zhu Ziqing, gravely ill, would rather starve to death than accept American relief grain' led to a widespread misunderstanding of the cause of Zhu Ziqing's death.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党、中华人民共和国、中国人民解放军的主要缔造者和领导人。其文章《别了，司徒雷登》中关于朱自清的描述影响深远。
description.en: The main founder and leader of the Communist Party of China, the People's Republic of China, and the People's Liberation Army. His description of Zhu Ziqing in the article 'Farewell, Leighton Stuart' had a profound impact.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国成立初期，由中国共产党领导的一场大规模政治运动，旨在肃清“反革命分子”。朱自清长子朱迈先在此运动中被处决。
description.en: A large-scale political movement led by the Communist Party of China in the early days of the People's Republic of China, aimed at eliminating 'counter-revolutionaries'. Zhu Ziqing's eldest son, Zhu Maixian, was executed during this campaign.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的执政党。
description.en: The ruling political party of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国天津市的一所著名大学，其在抗战期间与北大、清华合并为国立西南联合大学。
description.en: A renowned university in Tianjin, China, which merged with Peking University and Tsinghua University to form the National Southwest Associated University during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代诗人、学者、民主战士。
description.en: A modern Chinese poet, scholar, and democratic fighter.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的创建者与曾执政的政党。
description.en: The founding and formerly ruling political party of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 朱自清出生于江苏省东海县。
description.en: Zhu Ziqing was born in Donghai County, Jiangsu Province.

description.zh-cn: 朱自清于1917年奉父母之命与武钟谦结婚，直至1929年武钟谦因病去世。
description.en: Zhu Ziqing married Wu Zhongqian in 1917 under his parents' arrangement, until her death from illness in 1929.

description.zh-cn: 朱自清于1932年8月与陈竹隐结婚。
description.en: Zhu Ziqing married Chen Zhuyin in August 1932.

description.zh-cn: 朱物华是朱自清的二弟。
description.en: Zhu Wuhua is Zhu Ziqing's second younger brother.

description.zh-cn: 朱迈先是朱自清的长子。
description.en: Zhu Maixian is Zhu Ziqing's eldest son.

description.zh-cn: 1916年考入国立北京大学预科，1917年升入哲学系，1920年毕业。
description.en: Admitted to the preparatory school of National Peking University in 1916, entered the Department of Philosophy in 1917, and graduated in 1920.

description.zh-cn: 留学英国，在伦敦大学进修语言学和英国文学。
description.en: Studied abroad in the UK, pursuing advanced studies in linguistics and English literature at the University of London.

position.zh-cn: 中国文学系教授兼系主任
position.en: Professor and Head of the Department of Chinese Literature

description.zh-cn: 1925年到清华学校任教，后该校改名为国立清华大学。
description.en: Began teaching at Tsinghua School in 1925, which was later renamed National Tsinghua University.

position.en: Head of the Department of Chinese Literature

description.zh-cn: 1938年到昆明，任国立西南联合大学中国文学系主任。
description.en: Went to Kunming in 1938 to serve as the Head of the Department of Chinese Literature at National Southwest Associated University.

description.zh-cn: 为温州中学撰写校歌，其中名句“英奇匡国，作圣启蒙”成为该校校训。
description.en: Wrote the school song for Wenzhou High School, in which the famous line 'Cultivate talents to serve the nation, educate people to enlighten the future' became the school's motto.

description.zh-cn: 朱自清在五四运动期间上街游行，并受其影响开始写作新诗。
description.en: During the May Fourth Movement, Zhu Ziqing participated in street demonstrations and was inspired to start writing modern poetry.

description.zh-cn: 两人是晨光社的顾问，共同创办了《诗》月刊，并合著了《国文教学》等书，是文学上的长期伙伴。
description.en: They were advisors to the Morning Light Society, co-founded the 'Poetry' monthly, and co-authored books such as 'Teaching Chinese Language and Literature', making them long-term literary partners.

description.zh-cn: 与俞平伯、叶圣陶、刘延陵等人共同创办《诗》月刊。
description.en: Co-founded the 'Poetry' monthly with Yu Pingbo, Ye Shengtao, Liu Yanling, and others.

description.zh-cn: 在朱自清的散文处女作《桨声灯影里的秦淮河》发表后，周作人赞誉其为“白话美术文的模范”，推动了该作品的传播和认可。
description.en: After the publication of Zhu Ziqing's debut prose piece 'Paddle Sounds and Lantern Lights on the Qinhuai River', Zhou Zuoren praised it as 'a model of vernacular artistic prose', promoting its dissemination and recognition.

relationships.target: 抗议美国扶日政策并拒绝领取美援面粉宣言

description.zh-cn: 在《抗议美国扶日政策并拒绝领取美援面粉宣言》上签字表示支持。
description.en: Signed the 'Declaration of Protest against U.S. Policy of Aiding Japan and Refusal to Accept U.S. Relief Flour' to show support.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东在此文中称朱自清“宁可饿死，不领美国的救济粮”，此说法深刻影响了朱自清的公众形象，并导致对其死因的普遍误解。
description.en: In this article, Mao Zedong claimed that Zhu Ziqing 'would rather starve to death than accept American relief grain,' a statement that profoundly influenced Zhu Ziqing's public image and led to a widespread misunderstanding of his cause of death.

description.zh-cn: 朱自清长子朱迈先在1951年的镇反运动中被处决。
description.en: Zhu Ziqing's eldest son, Zhu Maixian, was executed during the Campaign to Suppress Counterrevolutionaries in 1951.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争期间，与国立清华大学、私立南开大学合并组成国立西南联合大学。
description.en: During the Second Sino-Japanese War, it merged with National Tsinghua University and the private Nankai University to form the National Southwest Associated University.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争期间，与国立北京大学、私立南开大学合并组成国立西南联合大学。
description.en: During the Second Sino-Japanese War, it merged with National Peking University and the private Nankai University to form the National Southwest Associated University.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争期间，与国立北京大学、国立清华大学合并组成国立西南联合大学。
description.en: During the Second Sino-Japanese War, it merged with National Peking University and National Tsinghua University to form the National Southwest Associated University.

description.zh-cn: 根据毛泽东在《别了，司徒雷登》中的描述，闻一多拍案而起，横眉怒对国民党的手枪，宁可倒下去，不愿屈服。
description.en: According to Mao Zedong's description in 'Farewell, Leighton Stuart', Wen Yiduo stood up defiantly against the Kuomintang's guns, preferring death to submission.
